#summary a general presentation about binary packers

= Introduction =

A packer is a generic word for a lot of different kind of tools, including: _compressor, encryptor, protector, obfuscater, patcher...

Their common point is that they all create a binary from a source binary, and the result should execute like the source binary.

they might compress the original data (compressor), encrypt it (encryptor), add some counter-measure (anti-* (debuggers/tools/VM...), obfuscate code with polymorphism or junk

= Compression =

the most common one is [http://www.ibsensoftware.com/products_aPLib.html Aplib], then [http://www.7-zip.org/sdk.html Lzma] & [http://www.bitsum.com/jcalg1.htm JCalg1].
